intro: Zinnia acerosa, commonly known as the rough zinnia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sunlight. Zinnia acerosa is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
